page.title: 02A Local Farm
page.content: Our farm covers 150 acres. The name of our farm is Upper Dudnill. The farmhouse is 313 years old. It was built in 1672. We have a sheepdog called Peggy. She gets the cows in to be milked every morning and night. My Grandad helps my dad on the farm. He is the shepherd. They do all the work between them. We keep cows, sheep and calves. We have cattleyards to keep the cows in. There are Friesian and Charolais cows and Suffolk and Clun sheep. We grow barley and maize which we feed to the animals. We sell our milk to the Milk Marketing Board. The milk goes into a tank from the milking parlour and a milk lorry comes to collect it. We have three tractors, a combine harvester and three trailers. Sometimes I make camps in the straw and hay in the barn.
